The Obama: era regulation, which was repealed by Trump, aimed to provide the National Instant Criminal Background Check System access to Social Security Administration data to flag individuals receiving certain federal mental health benefits.
The rule was rescinded using the Congres: a procedure that allows regulations passed in the final days of one administration to be repealed within the first 60 days of a new administration.
